title.narrative: Development of Strategy for PNPM Activities

description.narrative: PNPM is Indonesia's flagship program for poverty reduction launched by Indonesian President in April 2007, the program reaches 35,000 rural and urban villages in 2008, and expected to reach nationwide coverage of 70,000 villages by 2010. PNPM consists of un-earmarked block grants that are transferred directly to communities so that they can invest them in productive activities that were identified by communities through a facilitated planning process. Typical investments are tertiary roads, water and sanitation, and small irrigation schemes. Villagers increasingly include health and education facilities, which can be built only if district governments contribute service providers and materials and enter them into their district service plans. PNPM is managed through a national coordination team led by the Coordinating Minister for People's Welfare. It encompasses 11 ministries with Coord Minister for People Welfare managing the policy dimensions and The National Planning and Develop
